fields.name: BackendAddressPools
fields.description: An array of references to pool of DIPs.

fields.name: BackendPort
fields.description: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".

fields.name: DisableOutboundSnat
fields.description: Configures SNAT for the VMs in the backend pool to use the publicIP address specified in the frontend of the load balancing rule.

fields.name: EnableFloatingIP
fields.description: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

fields.name: EnableTcpReset
fields.description: Receive bidirectional TCP Reset on TCP flow idle timeout or unexpected connection termination. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

fields.name: FrontendPort
fields.description: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".

fields.name: IdleTimeoutInMinutes
fields.description: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

fields.name: LoadDistribution
fields.description: The load distribution policy for this rule.

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule.
